oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from Kenneth Redford to his sister regarding news and life in the military during World War I
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: In this handwritten letter, Musician Kenneth Redford, 114th FA, HQ Co., 30th Div., responds to the latest letter he received from his sister. He describes washing dishes and drying them with toilet paper. He mentions reading a letter to an illiterate comrade, recent recreational activities, and receiving packages. He also states that the government is sending horses, but the artillery is still drilling with wooden guns. Redford is stationed in Greenville, South Carolina at the time.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
